revised_title: Observations on the Whiteness of the Tongue in Fevers
tldr: The author, Anthony van Leeuwenhoek, investigates the whiteness on the tongue during fevers and uses a microscope to observe the protruded matter from the tongue. He concludes that the whiteness is not caused by stomach or bowel issues, but rather by the thick blood in fevers preventing proper nourishment to the tongue.
